mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 17th May instant, a negro-man, calling himself MOSES, saying he belongs to Dr. John Chevis, residing at Côte Gelée, in the Parish of Lafayette. -- Moses is about 23 years old, black complexion, five feet, nine inches high, having the right arm and hand smaller than the left, which, he says, was caused by having it put out of place when young. Speaks english only. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take him away, otherwise he will be disposed of according to law. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, 26th May 1855.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
